pr_title: [JENKINS-62757] Introduce fingerprint migration in External Storage API

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this be private? I'm curious why not have a mock for this object.
timeline.author: afalko

replies.bodyText:
I want to re-use this class in another test also. Would you suggest creating this in a separate file? I think that would be better.
So would you suggest using something like Mockito for this?
replies.author: stellargo

replies.bodyText: I think using Mockito might be better (you get coverage on the actual class instead of your test class) and lighter-weight, no?
replies.author: afalko

replies.bodyText: The only problem I think is that I want to test the functionality too. IIUC Mockito will give me a placeholder, but it cannot act as an external storage, which I want to test if it is working or not.
replies.author: stellargo

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                 * In case an external storage is configured on top of a file system based storage, first external storage is
          
          
            
                 * In case an external storage is configured on top of a file system based storage: 
          
          
            
            
          
          
            
                 1) External storage is...
          
          
            
                 2) If not found and fingerprint is present...
          
      
    
    
  

This description is difficult to read, see above suggestion on how to refactor it (basically don't have one long run-on sentence here :))
timeline.author: afalko
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1316,6 +1316,10 @@ public Api getApi() {
      * Loads a {@link Fingerprint} from the Storage with the given unique id.
      * @return Loaded {@link Fingerprint}. {@code null} if the config file does not exist or
      * malformed.
+     *
+     * In case an external storage is configured on top of a file system based storage, first external storage is

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Fingerprint.java b/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Fingerprint.java
index 91a74b21c8..7e460e7bcf 100644
--- a/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Fingerprint.java
+++ b/core/src/main/java/hudson/model/Fingerprint.java

@@ -1317,9 +1317,9 @@ public class Fingerprint implements ModelObject, Saveable {
      * @return Loaded {@link Fingerprint}. {@code null} if the config file does not exist or
      * malformed.
      *
-     * In case an external storage is configured on top of a file system based storage, first external storage is
-     * polled to retrieve the fingerprint, if not found then local storage is polled to retrieve the fingerprint if it
-     * is present there.
+     * In case an external storage is configured on top of a file system based storage:
+     * 1. External storage is polled to retrieve the fingerprint
+     * 2. If not found, then the local storage is polled to retrieve the fingerprint
      */
     public static @CheckForNull Fingerprint load(@NonNull String id) throws IOException {
         long start=0;

timeline.bodyText: Would be better to cache the storage implementations as local variables (current storage and then the Filesystem one). Apart from performance benefits, it reduces the chance of the logic exploding in unlikely case when the Storage gets reconfigured in the middle of the load() operation. Multi-threading 🤷
timeline.author: oleg-nenashev

replies.bodyText: I agree, thanks for pointing it out :) Done!
replies.author: stellargo

timeline.author: oleg-nenashev

timeline.message: Fix for undeleted in memory fingerprints
